text.section:
Except as otherwise provided in § 12-915(e) of this subtitle, the Commissioner may assess a civil penalty not exceeding $5,000 for each violation against a person who:
violates this subtitle;
violates a regulation adopted or order issued under this subtitle; or
operates in the State a boiler or pressure vessel, except a pressure vessel covered by an owner-user inspection service as provided by this subtitle, without a certificate.

In assessing the appropriateness of a civil penalty under this section, the Commissioner shall give due consideration to:
the nature or gravity of the violation;
the person's good faith; and
the person's history of previous violations.

section.section: A person may request a hearing before the Commissioner or the Commissioner's authorized representative to contest a proposed penalty or an alleged violation of this subtitle.
The Commissioner shall adopt regulations as reasonably necessary to carry out this subsection.
